evolve::Utility

evolve::Utility Namespace Reference

Detailed Description

An amalgam of useful methods String conversions, trim, etc, Nice place to wrap system calls like rand() & strtoll that may cause portability grief.


Functions

bool &  success,
bool  printDebug = true 
) [inline, static]

Converts a string to a <T> Bascially wraps around boost::lexical_cast and does error handling Verifies we have a number.

Parameters:
number the string to convert
success if the conversion succeeded
Returns:
the integer. If an error occurs, will return -1

template<class T>
static string evolve::Utility::toString ( T  type  )  [inline, static]

Converts a given variable of type T to a string (lazy edition) I just didn't bother with the error check enough to justify it.

Currently uses the boost::lexical_cast method, and can handle any type that that library can handle

Parameters:
type the variable you wish to be coverted to a string
success whether the conversion was successful
Returns:
the string representation of type

template<class T>
static string evolve::Utility::toString ( T  type,
bool &  success,
bool  printDebug = true 
) [inline, static]

Converts a given variable of type T to a string Currently uses the boost::lexical_cast method, and can handle any type that that library can handle.

Parameters:
type the variable you wish to be coverted to a string
success whether the conversion was successful
Returns:
the string representation of type

template<class T>
static string evolve::Utility::vectorToString ( const vector< T > &  vec,
bool &  success,
string  delim = ",",
bool  doDelim = true 
) [inline, static]

Handy util function for re-assembling the elements of the vector (into a string) Note that it only works if the given type T can be turned into a string using Utility::toString a vector of strings into one big string).

Parameters:
vec the vector to assemble
delim a delimiter to insert between vector elements
doDelim whether or not to add delimiters between the vector elements
